review: I really don't blame the device itself for the shortcomings of the chromecast. I had hoped it would basically turn my television into a wireless monitor. It doesn't really do that.It does a great job displaying Netflix or Youtube videos which is what is in fact made to do and "as described". The technology was just a little different than I expected. I had hoped to be able to put in a DVD or even use my flatscreen television as a giant monitor.I had made the assumption that it was some kind of wireless HDMI device, which it is..just not to the extent that I had hoped for I guess.

review: A great addition to any household where there are both computers and hd televisions.  Easy setup.  Just plug it in to the televisions hdmi port, plug in the power adapter, and turn on the tv.  Change the tv's video source to the hdmi port, and you should see the google chrome-cast booting up.Go to your computer (need wireless), and find a wireless network with the same name as the device shown on the television.  Follow the instructions for setting up the wireless network adapter to match you wireless settings.  That's it.Use a chrome browser, and you can use you big screen tv as a presentation monitor, watch Netflix movies, etc.
